message:
SYSTEM: PROLEGintro_eng_long.pdf: Página 58
Application to Constitution Law
• A general rule for freedom expression is that constraining expres-
sion is prohibited.
• However, if the purpose of constraining expression is compelling
and its constraining method is narrowly tailored, it is allowed.
• Also, if the constraint is content-neutral regulation, then the stan-
dard of judicial review becomes softer as an exception.
58
speaker: SYSTEM
